content.full_text: Receipt for 1845 City of Springfield Taxes, 6 January 18461 CITY OFSPRINGFIELD,January 61846. Received ofA LincolnEight25/100Dollars, in full for his City Tax, for the year 1845, on the following described property, to-wit:— Lot 12,, 13 Block 7E Ilesad2 L 8 & S 10 ft 7 Block 10 E Iles ad3
paragraphs: Receipt for 1845 City of Springfield Taxes, 6 January 18461 CITY OFSPRINGFIELD,January 61846. Received ofA LincolnEight25/100Dollars, in full for his City Tax, for the year 1845, on the following described property, to-wit:— Lot 12,, 13 Block 7E Ilesad2 L 8 & S 10 ft 7 Block 10 E Iles ad3
citations: Deed of Elijah Iles and Malinda Iles to Abraham Lincoln.
Deed of Charles Dresser and Louisa W. Dresser to Abraham Lincoln.

footnotes.text: 1James Maxcy wrote the document and signed for himself and Nicholas A. Garland.

2Abraham Lincoln purchased these two lots from Elijah Iles in 1838 for $300. The lots
                  were across Eighth Street from his home in the middle of the block.Deed of Elijah Iles and Malinda Iles to Abraham Lincoln.

3This property was Lincoln’s home at Eighth and Jackson streets in Springfield, which
                  he purchased fromCharles Dresserin 1844.Deed of Charles Dresser and Louisa W. Dresser to Abraham Lincoln.

structured_content.text: Receipt for 1845 City of Springfield Taxes, 6 January 18461
Received ofA LincolnEight25/100Dollars, in full for his City Tax, for the year 1845, on the following described property, to-wit:—
L[Lot] 8 & S[South] 10 ft[feet] 7 Block 10 E Iles ad3
